intro: Acrotrema thwaitesii, commonly known as the mountain heath, is a species of flowering plant belonging to the Ericaceae family. It is native to the mountainous regions of South America, particularly in countries like Chile and Argentina. The plant is characterized by its low-growing habit, with small, leathery leaves and clusters of bell-shaped flowers. It thrives in well-drained, acidic soils and is often found in high-altitude grasslands and shrublands. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
